module.title: fad
module.meta: length, long, while, for, all, whole, duration
module.p: fad length is an abstract (masculine) noun, derived from the adjective fada long.
Forms of fad are also used to introduce a temporal adverbial phrase or clause, as if it were a preposition or conjunction.
The main uses of fad are –

ol.li: As an abstract noun meaning length, the quality of being long

As a pseudo-preposition, governing a noun denoting a time interval, and introducing a temporal adverbial phrase of duration –
indefinite – bha sinn pòsta fad bliadhna we were married for a year
definite – bha sinn còmhla ri chèile fad na bliadhna we were together all year (long)

As a pseudo-conjunction fhad ’s a ..., governing an imperfective clause, and introducing a temporal adverbial clause of duration –
modifying an imperfective – as long as, (all the) while, e.g. fhad ’s a bha mi thall thairis, bha i ag obair all the while I was abroad, she was working
modifying a perfective – while, e.g. fhad ’s a bha mi thall thairis, phòs i while I was abroad, she got married

box.title: fad as a pseudo-preposition of temporal duration – indefinite uses
box.p: fad can be used as a kind of preposition introducing a time adverbial phrase describing the duration of a state or activity. When fad governs an indefinite time interval noun, it means something like English for.
See the corresponding durative use of airson for.

box.title: fad as a pseudo-preposition of temporal duration – definite uses
box.p: When the temporal durational pseudo-preposition fad governs a definite time interval noun, it corresponds to English all ... (long), the whole, throughout.

box.title: fhad ’s a as a temporal pseudo-conjunction – imperfective uses
box.p: fad can be used as a kind of conjunction, introducing an imperfective temporal adverbial clause describing the time period over which some other situation extends, or within which an action happens. In this sense, fad is usually lenited and conjoined using a contracted version of agus and with a relative clause, i.e. fhad ’s a (tha).

When the pseudo-conjunction fhad ’s a introduces a temporal adverbial which modifies an imperfective state or activity, it corresponds to the English conjunctions as long as, (all the) while. For example –

box.title: fhad’s a as a temporal pseudo-conjunction – perfective uses
box.p: When the pseudo-conjunction fhad ’s a introduces a temporal adverbial which modifies a perfective action or event, it corresponds to the English conjunction while. For example –
